Has anyone done this?  Can you describe which files/directories are 
necessary to copy to another location to verify a checkpoint using a 
"test" instance of Heritrix?

--David

On 1/10/2012 2:02 PM, John Lekashman wrote:
>
>>
>> 3) One big concern for us is invalid checkpoints. We would like to
>> verify that our checkpoints are valid. Is it possible to copy a subset
>> of a job directory to another location to use with another Heritrix job?
>> The idea would be to start a separate instance of Heritrix on separate
>> machine using this copied data and the last checkpoint to verify that
>> the last checkpoint is a valid checkpoint (no plans to actually crawl
>> from this test instance)? If possible this could also be useful for
>> debugging while still crawling with the original instance.
>>
> Yeah, I hate checkpoints.  Yes, this is possible.
> They fail at the most inopportune times.
